intro: Athamanta stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf tansy, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in compact clusters, blooming in the summer months. Athamanta stricta is often used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic effects.
